The 'Five Find-Outers', also known as the 'Enid Blyton Mystery Series' and 'Five
Find-Outers and Dog', is a series of children's mystery books written by Enid
Blyton and first published between 1943 and 1961. Set in the fictitious village
of Peterswood based on Bourne End, close to Marlow, Buckinghamshire, the
children encounter a mystery almost every school holiday, always solving the
puzzle before Mr Goon, the unpleasant village policeman, much to his annoyance.
